summary: Backend API testing completed for client deletion flow with allow-uninstall guard. All 7 tests passed, verifying the new deletion flow requirements.

success_rate.frontend: N/A - React Native/Expo app (skip per instructions)

seed_data_creation: Test clients created with TEST_ prefix during testing (auto-cleaned)
context_for_next_testing_agent: All requested backend features verified working. Key tests: 1) POST /api/admin/login with karli1987/nasvakas123 returns valid token. 2) DELETE /api/clients/{client_id} returns 400 if allow-uninstall not called first (error mentions 'Allow Uninstall'). 3) POST /api/clients/{client_id}/allow-uninstall sets uninstall_allowed=true on client. 4) DELETE /api/clients/{client_id} succeeds after allow-uninstall was called. 5) GET /api/clients/{client_id} returns is_registered field (defaults to false for new clients). 6) Full chain test (login->create->verify guard->allow-uninstall->delete) works correctly.
verified_features: DELETE /api/clients/{client_id} without allow-uninstall - returns 400 with message about uninstall (PASS)
Full chain login->create->allow-uninstall->delete - all steps work correctly (PASS)
